definition[0]: to continue doing something, or to do something many times
example[0]: You just have to keep on trying.
definition[1]: to continue to employ someone, especially for longer than you had planned
example[1]: If you’re good, they might keep you on after Christmas.
definition[2]: to talk continuously about something or repeat something many times, in a way that is annoying
example[2]: There’s no need to keep on and on about it!
example[3]: If I didn’t keep on at the children, they’d never do their homework.
